title: Effective Trap and Snare Placement
brief: Learn where and how to position traps for maximum effectiveness.
steps: Step 1: Look for animal runs (single species, small, less distinct) versus trails (multiple species, distinct).
Step 2: Search for tracks, droppings, chewed vegetation, and rubbed areas to confirm animal presence.
Step 3: Identify nesting sites, roosting sites, feeding areas, and watering holes.
Step 4: Place traps along trails connecting bedding areas to water and feeding areas.
Step 5: Position traps where there is definitive proof of regular animal passage.
Step 6: Avoid placing traps randomly in woods without evidence of animal activity.
warnings: A perfect trap in the wrong location will catch nothing.
Multiple species trails may indicate competition or danger for target animals.
Weather and seasonal changes affect animal movement patterns.
